src:
PSIS Semarang Vs PSS Sleman, Elang Jawa Bawa Misi Balas Dendam
01 Nov 2019, 03:33 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Kontributor), Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - PSS Sleman membawa misi balas dendam saat menantang tuan rumah PSIS Semarang pada lanjutan Liga 1 2019 yang dilangsungkan di Stadion Maguwoharjo Sleman, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Laga yang harusnya digelar di kandang PSIS Semarang itu terpaksa dialihkan ke kandang PSS Sleman karena persoalan perizinan.
Dalam laga kali ini PSS Sleman tak peduli meski secara klasemen di atas angin dibanding PSIS Semarang.
Yang jelas, anak asuh Seto Nurdiyantoro itu tak mau mengulang kekalahan lagi seperti terjadi di putaran pertama 17 Juli 2019 lalu. Saat itu di hadapan ribuan pendukungnya sendiri, Laskar Sembada justru dipermalukan skuad Mahesa Jenar dengan skor telak 1-3.
"Kami tidak akan melihat klasemen dan berkaca pada putaran pertama, kami ingin membalas kekalahan di kandang," ujar gelandang serang PSS Sleman Dave Mustaine 31 Oktober 2019.
Dave sendiri merasakan adanya keuntungan tersendiri bagi timnya untuk meraih poin maksimal karena laga tandang ini berasa laga kandang karena digelar di Sleman. Sehingga makin jadi pelecut memaksimalkan untuk meraih poin tiga.
Hanya situasi sedikit kurang menguntungkan tengah menyelimuti PSS Sleman. Sebab dua legiun asing andalan Elang Jawa, yakni Brian Federico Ferreira dan Alfonso de la Cruz masih diragukan untuk tampil saat laga kontra PSIS Semarang ini karena masih berkutat dengan masalah sakit dan cedera.
Keduanya pun sempat absen juga saat PSS Sleman sukses menekuk Persebaya Surabaya 3-2 di Surabaya pada 29 Oktober 2019 lalu.
"Alfonso dan Brian sesuai rekomendasi dokter masih harus istirahat dulu. Kemungkinan belum bisa tampil, tapi tetap kami tunggu rekomendasi dokter," ujar pelatih PSS Sleman Seto Nurdiyantoro.
PSIS Semarang memang patut waspada dengan tren positif yang tengah menaungi PSS Sleman itu. PSS Sleman tengah dalam kondisi on fire. Dalam empat pertandingan terakhir yang dilakoni, Lasker Elang Jawa sukses meraih tiga kali kemenangan dan hanya sekali imbang.

PRIBADI WICAKSONO
text:
PSIS Semarang Vs PSS Sleman, Javanese Elang Bring Revenge Mission
01 Nov 2019, 03:33 by Pribadi Wicaksono (Contributor), Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Yogyakarta - PSS Sleman is carrying out a revenge mission while challenging the host of PSIS Semarang in the 2019 League 1 continuation which was held at the Maguwoharjo Sleman Stadium on Saturday, November 2, 2019.
The match which was supposed to be held at the Semarang PSIS enclosure was forced to be transferred to the Sleman PSS enclosure due to licensing issues.
In this match PSS Sleman doesn't care even though the standings have the upper hand compared to PSIS Semarang.
What is clear, Seto Nurdiyantoro's foster children did not want to repeat the defeat again as happened in the first round of July 17, 2019 then. At that time in front of thousands of his own supporters, Laskar Sembada actually humiliated Mahesa Jenar's squad with a landslide score of 1-3.
"We will not see the standings and look in the mirror in the first round, we want to avenge defeat at home," said PSS Sleman attacking midfielder Dave Mustaine 31 October 2019.
Dave himself felt there was a distinct advantage for his team to gain maximum points because this away match was a home game because it was held in Sleman. So that it becomes increasingly a whistle to maximize to get point three.
Only a slightly less favorable situation was enveloping Sleman PSS. Because the two mainstay foreign legions of the Javanese Elang, namely Brian Federico Ferreira and Alfonso de la Cruz are still doubtful to appear during the counter PSIS Semarang match because they are still struggling with the problem of illness and injury.
Both of them were also absent when PSS Sleman successfully bent Persebaya Surabaya 3-2 in Surabaya on 29 October 2019.
"Alfonso and Brian according to the doctor's recommendation still need to rest first. It may not be able to perform, but we are still waiting for the doctor's recommendation," said Sleman PSS trainer Seto Nurdiyantoro.
PSIS Semarang deserves to be aware of the positive trend that is currently overseeing the Sleman PSS. PSS Sleman is on fire. In the last four games carried out, Lasker Elang Jawa won three wins and only one draw.

PERSONAL WICAKSONO
